unnormalised: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) has mandated linking of Permanent Account Number (PAN) with Know Your Customer (KYC) details for all bank accounts by 31/12/2024. This directive, outlined in circular RBI/2023-24/123, aims to enhance transparency and curb fraudulent activities in the financial system. Failure to comply may lead to operational restrictions on accounts, including a temporary freeze on transactions, as per Section 206AA of the Income Tax Act, 1961.
normalised: Reserve Bank of India (R-B-I) has mandated linking of Permanent Account Number (P-A-N) with Know Your Customer (K-Y-C) details for all bank accounts by thirty first december two thousand and twenty four. This directive, outlined in circular R-B-I slash two thousand and twenty three dash twenty four slash one hundred and twenty three, aims to enhance transparency and curb fraudulent activities in the financial system. Failure to comply may lead to operational restrictions on accounts, including a temporary freeze on transactions, as per Section two hundred and six double A of the Income Tax Act, one thousand nine hundred and sixty one.

unnormalised: The directive impacts all banking institutions, including SBI, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, and others operating in India. Account holders are advised to verify their PAN-KYC linkage status through their respective bank's online portal or by visiting a branch. Those who haven't linked their PAN can do so through various channels, including net banking, mobile banking apps, or by submitting a physical copy of their PAN card to their bank branch. Customers may need to quote their Customer Identification Number (CIN) during the process.
normalised: The directive impacts all banking institutions, including S-B-I, H-D-F-C Bank, I-C-I-C-I Bank, and others operating in India. Account holders are advised to verify their P-A-N dash K-Y-C linkage status through their respective bank's online portal or by visiting a branch. Those who haven't linked their P-A-N can do so through various channels, including net banking, mobile banking apps, or by submitting a physical copy of their P-A-N card to their bank branch. Customers may need to quote their Customer Identification Number (C-I-N) during the process.

unnormalised: RBI officials emphasize that the initiative is crucial for maintaining the integrity of the banking system. By linking PAN with KYC, it becomes easier to track financial transactions and identify any discrepancies, thereby reducing the risk of money laundering and other financial crimes. The circular also highlights the importance of updating KYC details regularly to ensure accuracy and compliance with regulatory norms. The reference number for this mandate is KYC/2024/PAN.
normalised: R-B-I officials emphasize that the initiative is crucial for maintaining the integrity of the banking system. By linking P-A-N with K-Y-C, it becomes easier to track financial transactions and identify any discrepancies, thereby reducing the risk of money laundering and other financial crimes. The circular also highlights the importance of updating K-Y-C details regularly to ensure accuracy and compliance with regulatory norms. The reference number for this mandate is K-Y-C slash two thousand and twenty four slash P-A-N.

unnormalised: Banks are expected to launch awareness campaigns to educate customers about the importance of PAN-KYC linkage. The RBI has urged banks to offer assistance and support to customers during this process, particularly for those who may face difficulties in accessing online channels or completing the required procedures. This initiative follows the RBI's earlier directive on Aadhaar seeding, further strengthening the KYC framework for financial institutions nationwide.
